RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 75. Maiden Claiming Purse 47000. INNER TURF (UP TO $8,178 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WISECRAKEN was hustled to the front, showed the way on the inside with company to his outside, shook clear near the half-mile pole, was asked midway through the final turn, lost the advantage under a drive in upper stretch, fought back gamely to get the lead again nearing the sixteenth-pole and narrowly prevailed under strong handling. ROCKSTAR RED stumbled at the start but broke with the field, rounded the first turn in the two path, was rated just off the pace, drafted inside on the far turn, was asked approaching the quarter-pole, gained in the two path into upper stretch then made a bid between foes, held a short lead while battling with multiple opponents into the final furlong, lost the advantage back to the winner before the sixteenth-pole, fought on to the wire and just missed while able to get the place. ELEVATED CAUSEWAY rounded the first turn in the three path, settled in the middle of the field, drafted behind horses in the two path on the far turn, was asked outside the quarter-pole then shifted four wide, lugged in under a left-handed crop while chasing in upper stretch, pursued the vanguard while continuing to lug in some and finished willingly for the show. COLLECT FROM IKE went four wide while taken under restraint on the first turn, was reserved under a snug hold on the outside but with some cover, traveled four wide while let out on the far turn then was roused near the five-sixteenths, gained to make a three wide bid into upper stretch, battled outside of two foes into the final sixteenth, swapped back to his inside late and was outfinished then lost the show. THEREGOESMYMIRACLE prompted the pace on the outside in the two path, dropped back near the half-mile pole, was given his cue in the two path on the far turn, chased into upper stretch and weakened. STEADY SCHEMING stalked the pace on the outside in the three path, dropped back late on the far turn and came up empty. INTERCHANGER was hustled from the gate, saved ground on the first turn, settled towards the back, was roused in the two path on the far turn and was no factor. SHAKIN THE BELLE traveled around the first turn in the two path, settled at the rear, was roused three wide on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Interchanger
ENTRY.OWNER: R A Hill Stable and SGV Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,ins1st,settled,ask2p2nd turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Shakin the Belle
ENTRY.OWNER: MC Stables and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,settled,roused 3w2nd,5w1/4,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Wisecraken
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,inside pace,ins foe,clr1/2,ask5/16,headed ins3/16,gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Theregoesmymiracle
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,prompted outside,drp back1/2,ask2p2nd,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Rockstar Red
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled brk,2p1st,rated,ins2nd,2p1/4,bid btwn3/16,led,denied

ENTRY.NAME: Elevated Causeway
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p1st,settled,2p2nd,ask ins 5/16,4w1/4,lugged in,willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Steady Scheming
ENTRY.OWNER: Flying P Stable and West Paces Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p1st,stlkd outside,ask3p2nd,drop back 5/16,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Collect From Ike
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w1st,snug hold outside,with cover,ask4w2nd,bid3p3/16,outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 82. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 85000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $45,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $45,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Afte rcare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MIA BEA STAR five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide at the nine-sixteenths before chasing just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing nearing the five-sixteenths, swung five wide into upper stretch, closed well outside to just get up in the final jump and prevail. AMANDA'S FOLLY showed the way in hand three paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, took the inside route into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in under growing lone threat and was nailed on the wire. CINDERELLA'S CAUSE chased four paths off the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coaxed along from the three-eighths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, ran on to secure the show honors. SWEET MYSTERY chased seven paths off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn getting placed to coaxing midway, swung four wide into upper stretch and kept on to the finish. MY FIRST LOVE chased three then two wide before tucking inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, tipped three wide into upper stretch and tired. VALLARAND bobbled at the break, chased six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn coming under prolonged coaxing from the half mile pole, swung four to five wide into upper stretch and made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: My First Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, ins turn, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Amanda's Folly
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 3p, ins turn, coaxed near 1/4, ins 1/4, edged clr, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Cinderella's Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4w, coaxed 2w 3/8, 2w 1/4p, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Mia Bea Star
ENTRY.OWNER: Reyana and Reya Racing and Rampersaud Totaram
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w early, to 3p 9/16, 2p turn, 5w upper, closed well, just up

ENTRY.NAME: Vallarand
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, 6w backstretch, 4w turn, 4-5w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Mystery
ENTRY.COMMENT: 7w backstretch, 3w turn, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, kept on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Perfect Sting S. BELMONT PARK RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 98. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 124 lbs. Non-winners of two sweepstakes at a mile or over in 2022-23 allowed 2 lbs.; of such a race in 2022-23 allowed 4 lbs.; of two races other thanm aiden, claiming, starter or State-bred allowance at a mile or over in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the main track. Closed Saturday, Junee
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EVVIE JETS showed speed while kept well out in the course, dropped in then moved to a solo lead when the runner-up was taken back off the pace at the three-quarter pole, was well rated while challenged from the outside, went around the turn in the two path, passed the quarter-pole under coaxing then responded well when shaken up in upper stretch, drifted out while fending off the runner-up inside the furlong marker, fought on well under a strong hand-ride to the finish and prevailed under good handling. TECHNICAL ANALYSIS (IRE) came out in front then showed speed, was taken back off the pace at the three-quarter pole then switched to the outside, moved up to prompt the leader, vied in the three path on the turn, was given her cue at the quarter-pole, battled outside the winner under a right-handed crop in the stretch and missed while clear for the place. HAUGHTY stalked the pace on the outside, was forced out near the five-eighths pole, went three then four wide on the turn, was roused at the five-sixteenths, chased the top two under a drive in the stretch and lacked the needed kick. TIC TIC TIC BOOM dropped back early then settled at the rear, was urged along in the two path on the turn, angled out in upper stretch and failed to threaten. CUSTOMER LIST (FR) settled off the pace, saved ground along the hedge on the turn, was asked at the five-sixteenths and lacked the needed response.

ENTRY.NAME: Customer List (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, inside turn, asked 5/16, came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Technical Analysis (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed,taken back 3/4,switch out,bid5/8,3p turn,ask1/4,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Haughty
ENTRY.OWNER: Bradley Thoroughbreds Belmar Racing and Breeding LLC Cambron Equine LLC and Team
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside,forced out 5/8,3-4w turn,ask5/16,chased,no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Tic Tic Tic Boom
ENTRY.OWNER: Guill Randolph J Steigler Gregory J and Bedard Andrew
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back,settled at rear,urged 2p turn,angled out,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Evvie Jets
ENTRY.OWNER: The Estate of Robert J Amendola
ENTRY.COMMENT: outside speed,solo lead3/4,ins foe5/8,2p,respond,drft ins1/8,held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 70000. (UP TO $12,180 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FANCY AZTECA coaxed from the gate, settled four then three wide in pursuit from just off the duel up front, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung three wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command at the three-sixteenths, then drew clear under a drive to prevail. CANDY CARAMEL lunged slightly at the break, chased four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, floated out eight wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while running on to be along clear for the place honors, second best. VAX lunged slightly at the start, chased five then four wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung five wide into upper stretch and improved position to procure the show honors. GIRL AFRAID broke out at the start bumping TRIBAL QUEEN into BABY SOX, dueled from the two path with BABY SOX to her outside, tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch, yielded the front with three-sixteenths to go and weakened. TRIBAL QUEEN got bumped at the start by GIRL AFRAID and in turn bumped BABY SOX getting pinched back, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and tired. BABY SOX got bumped at the start by TRIBAL QUEEN due to pressure from GIRL AFRAID while under hustling, dueled three then two wide with GIRL AFRAID to her inside, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung two to three wide for home in the midst of being shaken off and folded in the stretch. LUNA LOCA coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, took the inside route into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Luna Loca
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed ins 3/8, inside 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Girl Afraid
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, dueled 2p, ins turn, inside 1/4, yielded 3/16, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Tribal Queen
ENTRY.OWNER: Harold Lerner LLC AWC Stables Nehoc Stables Akman Scott K and Braverman Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, pinched st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Baby Sox
ENTRY.OWNER: Tanzman David Speranza Steven Hablan Los Caballos LLC and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, hustled st, dueled 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w upper, folded

ENTRY.NAME: Fancy Azteca
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 4-3w off duel, 3w upper, up 3/16, drew clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Jack T. Hammer & T/C Stable, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Candy Caramel
ENTRY.OWNER: Barber Gary and Pell Richard C
ENTRY.COMMENT: slight lunge st, chased 4-5w, 3w turn, floated 8w uppr, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Vax
ENTRY.COMMENT: slight lunge st, chased 5-4w, coaxed 3/8, 5w upper, improved

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 82. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Pr eferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHE SLAYS broke a half-step slow and was a bit slow into stride, angled out early, settled comfortably off the pace, was roused four wide on the turn, rallied outside under a left-handed crop in upper stretch, closed strongly to get the lead coming to the furlong marker, drifted in while kicking clear outside the sixteenth-pole and proved much the best while placed under a hand-ride in the final sixteenth. SOUFFLE broke out and hit the gate, stalked the pace on the outside, engaged the leader on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole then came under a drive in upper stretch, battled into the final furlong and proved no match for the winner while just able to get the place. BE BEST was hustled from the gate, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside of a foe in the two path on the turn, was asked at the quarter-pole then came under a drive in upper stretch, fought with the top two into the final furlong and also proved no match for the winner then just missed the place. UNHOLY was hustled from the start then well placed just off the pace, chased inside on the turn, turned into the stretch in the two path and tired. SHOTGUN PATSY broke a bit slow, was carried out early then steadied briefly while taken back then angled in, saved ground under urging on the turn and failed to threaten. LADY FORTUNA came outward while off a half-step slow then dropped back, took an awkward stride near the five-eighths pole, fell well behind the rest of the field, navigated the turn in the three path and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Unholy
ENTRY.OWNER: Blue Lion Thoroughbreds Skelly Matthew S and Asmussen Steven M
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,well placed,chased inside turn,2path into lane,tired

ENTRY.NAME: She Slays
ENTRY.OWNER: Brennan Niall J Mitola Anthony and Andrews Dennis L
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit slw stride,angld out,settld,4w trn,rally,lead1/8,drift in,clr

ENTRY.NAME: Shotgun Patsy
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit slw st,carried out,brief stdy,mvd in,inside turn,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Be Best
ENTRY.OWNER: Gatsas Stables R A Hill Stable Swick Stable and Smart Choice Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,set pace,ins foe 2p trn,ask1/4,no match,missed2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Souffle
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,hit gate,stalked outside,bid1/2,ask1/4,fought,no match

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Fortuna
ENTRY.COMMENT: came out,off 1/2 step slow,dropped back,3w turn,no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 87. Allowance Purse 80000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 1 25 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KING OF COMEDY established the front from the get go and showed the way in hand along the inside, widened away briefly five and a half furlongs from home before continuing along the inside into the far turn allowing the field to advance once more, got roused taking the inside route into upper stretch, went clear under a drive to prevail. WHISTLER'S HONOR settled two to three wide near the rear of the field, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, kicked on belatedly to be along clear of the rest and second best while never threatening the winner. PROVISION tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch, kept on to secure the show honors. OPEN TIL MIDNIGHT just off the inside in closest aim of the leader, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and weakened in the late stages. CLEAR CONSCIENCE settled just off the inside in pursuit from mid pack, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung three wide into upper stretch in behind a trio of foes across the track, attempted to lean out on and nudge SELL SOMETHING at the three-sixteenths and near the eighth pole and was denied the move both times by that rival keeping his proper lane, then got clear once that foe backed away and offered no kick. BARREL OF QUESTS saved ground in pursuit from mid pack, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and took the inside route into upper stretch and got paused behind foes to near the eighth pole tipping briefly to the two path before getting clearance inside, tucked inside and took that clear lane and offered no response. NOBLE HUNTSMAN settled just off the inside near the rear of the field, came under coaxing along the inside at the five-sixteenths and began to tip out at that station, angled six wide into upper stretch and offered no rally while passing a pair of foes in the late stages. BLAME IT ON DADDY forwardly placed three wide through the first turn, settled three wide just off the top pair, continued three wide through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and weakened in the late going. SELL SOMETHING settled just off the inside tracking the front from near the rear of the field, tipped out three then four wide through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, had CLEAR CONSCIENCE lean out at the three-sixteenths to take over his lane and denied the move, got leaned on once more by that same rival nearing the eighth pole and once again denied the nudge keeping his rightful lane, then backed away and weakened to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Provision
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, coaxed 5/16, ins 1/4, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Whistler's Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w near rear, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, belatedly, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Noble Huntsman
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p at rear, coaxed ins 5/16, angled 6w upper, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: King of Comedy
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp Staudacher David Maxis Stable and Gardella Jeff
ENTRY.COMMENT: uncontested ins, widened 5 1/2, ins turn, ins 1/4p, went clear

ENTRY.NAME: Barrel of Quests
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved grd mid pack, beh foes to 1/8, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Clear Conscience
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p mid pack, 3w uppr, denied lean out 2x str, beh to 1/8p,no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Sell Something
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, coaxed 3-4w 5/16, 4w uppr, leaned on 3/16 & 1/8, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Open Til Midnight
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Blame It On Daddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w both turns, just off pace 3w, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, wknd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 1 1/16M Turf CR: 80. Claiming Purse 48000. (UP TO $8,352 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (1.5% Aftercare Asses sment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile and One Sixteenth on the Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BERNT AGAIN was reserved off the pace under restraint, went two then three wide on the turn, was roused while shifting four wide coming to the quarter-pole, rallied outside to make a bid into upper stretch, held a short lead into the final furlong, battled outside of three foes into the final sixteenth and prevailed under strong urging. FROSTY INVASION was taken under a tight hold early, bobbled slightly near the seven-eighths, was rated just off the pace under tight restraint, drafted behind the leaders on the far turn, made a bid along the hedge in upper stretch, battled inside under a stiff drive into the final sixteenth, fought on well to the finish but missed while able to get the place. SNOW LOVES A FIGHT was coaxed to the front then taken under a snug hold after getting the lead, gave up the advantage under tight restraint at the three-quarter pole then was rated just off the pace, made a bid late on the backstretch, drew even with the leader while inside on the turn, passed the five-sixteenths with a narrow advantage, was given her cue near the quarter-pole, battled between horses under a drive into the final sixteenth and was outfinished while just able to get the show. SISTER NELL pulled under tight restraint on the outside, dragged her way forward to the lead at the three-quarter pole then showed the way, vied in the two to three path on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole then came under a drive, battled between foes into the final sixteenth and was out-kicked. DIVINE WINE bumped with a foe at the start, was reserved under restraint, came under urging in the three path on the turn, was put to the crop outside the five-sixteenths, moved out in upper stretch and failed to rally. SUSIE'S SAVER bumped with a rival at the start, bobbled near the seven-eighths pole, settled at the rear, was roused while saving ground and bobbling a touch on the far turn, moved out in upper stretch and failed to threaten. ROSEMARY POTATOES stalked the pace on the outside under a hold, was asked in the three to four path on the turn, dropped back five wide into the stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Frosty Invasion
ENTRY.OWNER: Rosenthal Robert D Greenberg Martin and Rosenthal Peter
ENTRY.COMMENT: tight hold,rated inside,hedge bid 3/16,fought on well,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Bernt Again
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved,2-3path turn,roused 4w1/4,bid3/16,lead1/8,prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Susie's Saver
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,bobbled 7/8,at rear,inside turn,mvd out,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Divine Wine
ENTRY.OWNER: Red Storm Stable and Stuchbury Gerard
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,tight hold,reserved,ask3w turn,mvd out,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Snow Loves a Fight
ENTRY.OWNER: Noda Orlando and Final Turn Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed to front,tight hold,gave up lead,rated,ins turn,outfinishd

ENTRY.NAME: Rosemary Potatoes
ENTRY.COMMENT: tight hold,stalked outside,asked 3-4p turn,drop back5w1/4,falter

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Nell
ENTRY.COMMENT: hard held early,pulled,mvd up3/4,lead,2-3p turn,ask1/4,outfinishd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 92. Claiming Purse 62000. (UP TO $10,788 NYSBFOA) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $32,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOST IN ROME coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to prevail. ALFIO coaxed from the start, chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick. NO MORE TALK chased six then five wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung five wide into upper stretch, came in slightly brushing with DURKIN'S CALL straightened away, ran on to secure the show honors. FLAMINGO HAWK hustled from the start, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun two to three wide into upper stretch, paused from inside the three-sixteenths to the eighth pole taking a snug hold on the reins as though lugging in although that didn't appear to be the case, got engaged by the rider once more nearing the sixteenth marker and offered up a mild bid for the last major share. FIRST DEPUTY coaxed from the gate, chased six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung six wide into upper stretch and made no headway while making some ground late. DURKIN'S CALL chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch getting brushed by NO MORE TALK straightened away and tired. RAGTIME BLUES led briefly before conceding the front to LOST IN ROME, prompted that rival from the outside three then two wide, had the rider peer back to the outside and then inside while taking a protective hold, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and was eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Lost in Rome
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 2p, coaxed near 1/4, 2w 1/4p, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Alfio
ENTRY.OWNER: Quartarolo Anthony T Granata Thomas J Quartarolo Ashley and Meyers Shane
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Flamingo Hawk
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w uppr, paused, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: First Deputy
ENTRY.OWNER: Begg James Bentley and Upland Flats Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 6w backstretch, 4w turn, 6w upper, no headway

ENTRY.NAME: Ragtime Blues
ENTRY.COMMENT: led briefly, prompted 3-2w, 3-4w upper, protected, eased home

ENTRY.NAME: Durkin's Call
ENTRY.OWNER: Baker Charlton and Foster Michael S
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: No More Talk
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 6-5w, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, ran on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 9 1 1/4M Inner turf CR: 86. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. INNER TURF (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HIGH STICK moved in while going to the front, showed the way on the inside, was asked nearing the quarter-pole then came under a drive in upper stretch, responded well when put to a right-handed crop outside the furlong marker and held under steady urging. LIBRETTO (IRE) went five then four wide on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, vied three wide on the far turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, chased the winner under a left-handed crop in the stretch and was outfinished while just able to get the place. TAWARET was taken under a tight hold early, traveled four then three wide on the first turn, was rated off the pace, came under urging in the two path while between foes on the far turn, was driven three wide into the stretch and finished willingly to just miss the place while clear for the show. WARDEYA was bumped in the hindquarters at the start, raced near the back under stout restraint, saved ground on the first turn, was reserved off the pace, moved from the two path to the four path on the far turn, was roused late on that bend then came five wide into the stretch, lugged in while chasing outside in the stretch and improved position but lacked the needed kick. WAY TOO EARLY went three then two wide on the first turn, prompted the pace on the outside, was given her cue in the two path on the far turn, dropped back under a drive in upper stretch and tired. JET CITY WOMAN went three wide under restraint on the first turn, was reserved off the pace, traveled three wide under urging on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch and failed to rally. GEOMETRIQUE went four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside without cover, was given cover inside the five-eighths, dropped from the three path to the two path on the far turn, spun three wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. SETTLING STORM stumbled awkwardly at the start, was taken under a tight hold early, hit the rail while tight along the inside going around the first turn, was rated just off the pace, came under urging on the far turn, chased into the stretch and capitulated. TRES CHIC (ARG) bumped with rivals at the start, stumbled in the two path on the first turn then was taken up and had the rider lose his left iron for a few strides, dropped to the rear onto the backstretch then fell well behind, saved ground on the far turn and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Settling Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: stmbld brk,hit rail 1st,rated inside,ask2nd turn,empty
